mainEntity.name: Are all budget-friendly cars on CARS24 inspected before listing?

acceptedAnswer.text: All CARS24-listed used cars under 20 lakhs are thoroughly inspected across 300+ checkpoints for mechanical quality and road readiness. Dealer-listed cars are inspected as per the dealer's own process, and individual seller cars are also pre-inspected before listing. For added confidence, you can purchase a detailed 300-point inspection report on seller listings to make an informed decision.

mainEntity.name: Is RC transfer support provided for every listing type?

acceptedAnswer.text: CARS24 handles the entire RC transfer process for used cars under 20 lakhs listed directly by us. Most dealers also assist with ownership transfer. For seller listings, CARS24 offers optional paid RC transfer support to take care of documentation, challan clearance, and final handover.

mainEntity.name: What is the Safe Payment Service?

acceptedAnswer.text: For seller-listed second hand cars under 20 lakhs, CARS24 offers a Safe Payment Service that holds your payment securely until both you and the seller confirm that the vehicle has been delivered. This adds an extra layer of trust and removes uncertainty from the transaction. The service is only applicable when payment is made through the CARS24 platform, subject to a nominal fee.

mainEntity.name: What kind of car inspection reports are available on CARS24?

acceptedAnswer.text: CARS24-listed second hand cars under 20 lakhs go through a comprehensive 300+ point inspection covering key mechanical and safety checks. Individual seller 2nd hand cars under 20 lakhs are also pre-inspected, and buyers can purchase a detailed inspection report for ₹382 + GST. While dealer-listed used cars under 20 lakhs do not have an option to purchase an inspection report, high-quality images and detailed specifications are clearly disclosed on the listing.

mainEntity.name: What happens if I change my mind after buying a second hand car?

acceptedAnswer.text: CARS24-listed 2nd hand cars under 20 lakhs come with an optional extended warranty up to 3 years alongside standard coverage. Dealer and seller listings do not include a return policy by default, so we recommend reviewing terms carefully before booking.

mainEntity.name: How do I know I’m dealing with genuine sellers or dealers?

acceptedAnswer.text: All dealer partners on CARS24 are verified through KYC, GST, and dealership documents. Individual sellers are validated through ID, address, and phone verification. This helps ensure you're interacting only with trusted and legitimate sources, no matter which route you choose.

mainEntity.name: How do I know if the price of a car is fair?

acceptedAnswer.text: CARS24 uses an AI-powered pricing indicator on all dealer and seller listings, categorising prices as “Great,” “Good,” “Fair,” or “High.” This helps you quickly understand how a used car under 20 lakhs is priced in relation to market trends, so you can make a confident decision based on your budget.

mainEntity.name: Can I test drive a used car under my budget before making a purchase?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, if you're buying a used car under 20 lakhs from the CARS24 inventory, you can either visit the nearest hub or opt for a home test drive, available for a nominal, refundable fee. For listings from verified dealers, you can schedule a test drive directly through the CARS24 platform—dealers usually confirm the timing. If the car is listed by an individual seller, a test drive can be arranged based on mutual availability.

mainEntity.name: Is resale value affected by buying a budget car?

acceptedAnswer.text: Budget-friendly models from reputed brands often have stable resale value. Popular hatchbacks and entry-level sedans, especially from Maruti, Hyundai, and Honda, tend to retain value better.

mainEntity.name: Which body type offers the best value for money on a low budget?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hatchbacks typically offer the best value on a low budget. They’re fuel-efficient, cost-effective to maintain, and ideal for city driving. They also dominate the budget used car market due to wide availability and affordability.

mainEntity.name: Should I buy a petrol or diesel car under 20 lakhs budget?

acceptedAnswer.text: Petrol cars are usually better suited for city driving and are more affordable upfront. Diesel cars may offer better mileage for highway use, but may cost more in maintenance and repairs, especially if you're looking at older diesel engines.

mainEntity.name: Which brands offer reliable options within a limited budget?

acceptedAnswer.text: Brands like Tata, Mahindra, MG, KIA, Toyota consistently rank well for affordability, spare part availability, and lower ownership costs—ideal for budget-conscious buyers.

mainEntity.name: Are automatic cars available within a lower budget range?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, entry-level automatics—especially AMT (Automated Manual Transmission)—are now common even under ₹15.00 lakh. They’re great for city traffic, though you may have to compromise slightly on performance or variant-level features compared to manuals.

mainEntity.name: How do I check if the car price is fair for the features and condition offered?

acceptedAnswer.text: Compare similar listings on multiple platforms, check recent resale trends for the same model, and evaluate the car’s age, mileage, and ownership history. Tools like used car value calculators or speaking to local garages can help benchmark pricing.

mainEntity.name: Is it better to buy an older top-end model or a newer base variant on a budget?

acceptedAnswer.text: Older top-end models often offer more features—like airbags, ABS, alloy wheels, and infotainment systems—at a similar price to newer base variants. However, newer models typically offer better fuel efficiency, updated safety norms, and lower wear-and-tear risks. If reliability and warranty coverage are important, a newer base variant might be better. If comfort and features matter more, a well-maintained older variant could offer better value.
